page.title: 09HOUSING1-BUILDING AND TENURE
page.content: 32 housholders(c.45% sample) responded to our{housing}questionare. These consist of 28 owner-occupiers, 3 private tenants, no council tenants (there are none), and 1 "other" unspecified. 27(84%) of these houses are built in Cotswold Limestone, with {buildings and landscape}in harmony. Most houses are old, over half date from the 18th and 19th c. and some others are much older. The few 20th c. houses all post-war with significant groups in the late 1960's, and especially the 1980's which is represented by a close of "executive" detached houses and two more traditional terraces. All are stone built, owner-occupied and expensive. 25 housholders offered"type" descriptions, 10-detached, 4-semi detached, 5-terraced, 3-farmhouses, and 3-cottages.
